commit_message:
Fix warnings in specs repo

The specs job hasn't been published in a while and I wondered if
warnings could be causing it. This patch clears up those warnings.

Change-Id: I5e888782d2e62781f44862f2821069fa5b34bec4

subject: revise deletion policy to support 'health check'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-28 09:08:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/b9bea4b091caf29f733889622d31e43ea5909f67', 'message': 'revise deletion policy to support 'health check'

In my mind, I have 2 ways to revise deletion policy to support 'health_check':
1. Do not hurt current logic, add cluster.health_check() into deletion policy to
check the physical resources, but this will be a heavy work for large scale
cluster since it is a sequential procedure.

2. Revise deletion policy which moves the selecting procedure to action layer, so
that we can trigger 'cluster_check' action to sync the physical resources if the
'health_check' was set to True by scaling policy/request obj.

Please review, and hope we can find another better way to do this work.

This patch adds 2 method victioms_by_regions() and victims_by_zones()
to engine.cluster

Here is the example data if we have all policies:
{"deletion": {
     "count": 4,
     "regions": {
         "RegionOne": 2,
         "RegionTwo": 2
     },
     "zones": {
         "nova-1": 2, # Default Region
         "nova-2": 2, # Default Region
     },
     "destroy_after_deletion": True/False,
     "grace_period": 0,
     "reduce_desired_capacity": True/False,
     "health_check": None/True/False,
     "criteria": "RANDOM",
}}

The selecting procedure will be done in action layer based on the value of
'criteria' field dumped by deletion policy and the decision from region/zone
policy if any.

'health_check' will be set to None if no scaling policy attached to cluster,
so that the action layer can tell, then try to get it from action.inputs.

Change-Id: I0b52b6e7d8b65a198bc35fe97acaaf8207843cb7
Implements: blueprint scaling-action-support-health-check

commit_message:
revise deletion policy to support 'health check'

In my mind, I have 2 ways to revise deletion policy to support 'health_check':
1. Do not hurt current logic, add cluster.health_check() into deletion policy to
check the physical resources, but this will be a heavy work for large scale
cluster since it is a sequential procedure.

2. Revise deletion policy which moves the selecting procedure to action layer, so
that we can trigger 'cluster_check' action to sync the physical resources if the
'health_check' was set to True by scaling policy/request obj.

Please review, and hope we can find another better way to do this work.

This patch adds 2 method victioms_by_regions() and victims_by_zones()
to engine.cluster

Here is the example data if we have all policies:
{"deletion": {
     "count": 4,
     "regions": {
         "RegionOne": 2,
         "RegionTwo": 2
     },
     "zones": {
         "nova-1": 2, # Default Region
         "nova-2": 2, # Default Region
     },
     "destroy_after_deletion": True/False,
     "grace_period": 0,
     "reduce_desired_capacity": True/False,
     "health_check": None/True/False,
     "criteria": "RANDOM",
}}

The selecting procedure will be done in action layer based on the value of
'criteria' field dumped by deletion policy and the decision from region/zone
policy if any.

'health_check' will be set to None if no scaling policy attached to cluster,
so that the action layer can tell, then try to get it from action.inputs.

Change-Id: I0b52b6e7d8b65a198bc35fe97acaaf8207843cb7
Implements: blueprint scaling-action-support-health-check
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/84/460884/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from senlin.common import scaleutils as su def victims_by_regions(self, regions, criteria): """Filter the candidates to be removed from cluster. :param regions: A dictionary which the key is the region name and the value is the number of nodes belong to this region. :param criteria: Criteria used in selecting candidates for deletion. :return: A list of selected candidates for deletion. """ victims = [] for region in sorted(regions.keys()): count = regions[region] nodes = self.nodes_by_region(region) if criteria == 'RANDOM': candidates = su.nodes_by_random(nodes, count) elif criteria == 'OLDEST_PROFILE_FIRST': candidates = su.nodes_by_profile_age(nodes, count) elif criteria == 'OLDEST_FIRST': candidates = su.nodes_by_age(nodes, count, True) else: candidates = su.nodes_by_age(nodes, count, False) victims.extend(candidates) return victims def victims_by_zones(self, zones, criteria): victims = [] for zone in sorted(zones.keys()): count = zones[zone] nodes = self.nodes_by_zone(zone) if criteria == 'RANDOM': candidates = su.nodes_by_random(nodes, count) elif criteria == 'OLDEST_PROFILE_FIRST': candidates = su.nodes_by_profile_age(nodes, count) elif criteria == 'OLDEST_FIRST': candidates = su.nodes_by_age(nodes, count, True) else: candidates = su.nodes_by_age(nodes, count, False) victims.extend(candidates) return victims

commit_message:
revise action layer to filtering nodes can be removed

this patch moves the logic of choosing candidates that need to be removed from
deletion policy to action layer, which means, the policy can provide some data that
based on the policy content, but the decision will be made by the action layer.

Change-Id: Ifd5a2218a2d96405555da9e0dceb868e2aecddee

commit_message:
support 'health_check' parameter for scaling action

this patch adds logs to actions.base.policy_check() to support 'health_check'.

Let's goback to the demand, we want to do physical resources checking before
scaling actions because we want to know the exactly status of the nodes,
so that we can destroy the correct nodes(bad status first).

4 situations:

a. no policies at all
b. no scaling poilcies, has other policies
c. has scaling policies, no other policies
d. has scaling policies, has otheer policies

Current refactor will handle 'b' and 'd', and additional support in do_xyz()
is needed...
Hope this is not ugly :(

Change-Id: I076537fdb99d39a325eb8b2ad19d00407f010b20

commit_message:
rehome NETWORK_ID ml2 constant

Commit 2d6290daf78112a8525f48b79d2432f0f174828f added the NETWORK_ID
constant to the ml2 driver api. This patch syncs it over into lib.

commit_message:
use constants rather than static strings

A number of the existing API defs use static strings rather than using
existing constants. This patch replaces those static strings with their
respective constants where applicable.

Change-Id: I505f10b58a454bd7c90725abbc62cc8a7fd46d94
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/34/462534/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
make extra_dhcp_opt vars public

The extra_dhcp_opt api-def variables VALID_BLANK_EXTRA_DHCP_OPTS and
DHCP_OPT_VALUE_MAX_LEN may need to be referenced by consumers; for
example during data processing [1]. While consumers can access these
values indirectly via the api-def's EXTRA_DHCP_OPT_KEY_SPECS, it's
a bit messy.

This patch makes those variables public allowing consumers to reference
them from a single simple location.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/extradhcpopt_db.py#L32

Change-Id: I9f9898ba400f3786ef643bbcba744c035c77089f

commit_message:
Handle overwrite in envs without schema

If environments overwrites a parameter defaults for a parameter without
a schema (defined in a nested stack, for example), this detect the value
type and tries to use it anyway.

Change-Id: I74e78f7c6318298b20528630743854700f4d4b5a
Closes-Bug: #1669571

commit_message:
Deprecate elilo support for UEFI

It is not maintained for several years, and many distributions no longer
include it in their recent version.

Change-Id: I7851bd18ca4c0b2801ce7632629e8cc951044903

subject: Disable swift service in patrole py35 gate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-11 02:48:39.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/patrole.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/65a57cbadb8c9bcffcceff39cc02454ab4fc4fbc', 'message': 'Disable swift service in patrole py35 gate

The new dsvm gate,
"gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-py35-member-ubuntu-xenial-nv", is
failing during the execution of the main stack.sh script [0],
because glance fails to upload an image [1]. This is likely
because glance is using swift as the storage back-end,
which according to tempest's py35 gate template, should be
disabled, as "it isn't ready for python 3 yet" [2].

This patch disables swift for the py35 gate, along
with c-bak, as according to [2], it requires swift in the
gate.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/71/462671/6/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-py35-member-ubuntu-xenial-nv/25dc23e/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz

Change-Id: I092796b1b1eb7b4c1f011d6214fb1b03ad4f95aa
Closes-Bug: #1689960
'}]
commit_message:
Disable swift service in patrole py35 gate

The new dsvm gate,
"gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-py35-member-ubuntu-xenial-nv", is
failing during the execution of the main stack.sh script [0],
because glance fails to upload an image [1]. This is likely
because glance is using swift as the storage back-end,
which according to tempest's py35 gate template, should be
disabled, as "it isn't ready for python 3 yet" [2].

This patch disables swift for the py35 gate, along
with c-bak, as according to [2], it requires swift in the
gate.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/71/462671/6/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-py35-member-ubuntu-xenial-nv/25dc23e/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz
[1] http://logs.openstack.org/71/462671/6/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-py35-member-ubuntu-xenial-nv/25dc23e/logs/screen-g-api.txt.gz
[2] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml#L659

Change-Id: I092796b1b1eb7b4c1f011d6214fb1b03ad4f95aa
Closes-Bug: #1689960
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/85/463885/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Swift is not ready for python3 yet disable_service s-account disable_service s-container disable_service s-object disable_service s-proxy # Without Swift, c-bak can't run (in the Gate at least) disable_service c-bak

commit_message:
Remove FnBase64 from Resource

This is not used. I'm not convinced this has *ever* been used. Even the
actual Base64 function doesn't actually convert to base64.

Change-Id: Ibf47371f614651870d3b681f0c33d4c223cd09e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/04/461504/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: import base64 def FnBase64(self, data): """For the intrinsic function Fn::Base64. :param data: the input data. :returns: the Base64 representation of the input data. """ return base64.b64encode(data)

subject: Less unicode weirdness in short_id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-01 20:45:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/4e0883695fcf40a0589025cc85b8022c1d5ff27e', 'message': 'Less unicode weirdness in short_id

The function _to_byte_string() deals with binary data, so it should
return... a byte string.

Also Base32 uses strictly valid ASCII characters, so it can be decoded as

Change-Id: I24b625a41eb8f7fd47f4a3df7ac53c598b01abb6
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-01 21:11:34.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_short_id.py', 'heat/common/short_id.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/6834733212244b4ffde712f5caf475f28e940d7b', 'message': 'Less unicode weirdness in short_id

The function _to_byte_string() deals with binary data, so it should
return... a byte string.

Also Base32 uses strictly valid ASCII characters, so it can be decoded as
ASCII.

This effectively reverts commit 15cbb894f29c25b7c929dc368e11a211a7968adb.

Change-Id: I24b625a41eb8f7fd47f4a3df7ac53c598b01abb6
'}]
commit_message:
Less unicode weirdness in short_id

The function _to_byte_string() deals with binary data, so it should
return... a byte string.

Also Base32 uses strictly valid ASCII characters, so it can be decoded as
ASCII.

This effectively reverts commit 15cbb894f29c25b7c929dc368e11a211a7968adb.

Change-Id: I24b625a41eb8f7fd47f4a3df7ac53c598b01abb6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/03/461503/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return b''.join(six.int2byte(byte_at(offset)) for offset in shifts) encoded_bytes = base64.b32encode(random_bytes)[:12] return encoded_bytes.decode('ascii').lower()
deleted_lines: return ''.join(six.unichr(byte_at(offset)) for offset in shifts) encoded = base64.b32encode(random_bytes.encode('latin-1'))[:12] return encoded.lower().decode('latin-1')

commit_message:
Remove nova docker instruction from quickstart

NovaDocker driver has known issue (i.e. network resources created
in a single tenant). Let's remove it from quickstart guide for now.
Devs are suggested to use native Docker driver as a quickstart.

Change-Id: I8915c5b175deeb1efd7a126f171483be3fcd38e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/00/465200/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: By default, devstack will enable docker driver in Zun. Alternatively, you can enable nova-docker driver instead. If nova-docker driver is enabled, zun will use Nova to manage `container sandboxes <https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/specs/container-sandbox.rst>`_. Simply speaking, you should choose nova-docker driver if you want to get containers with networking provided by Neutron. Otherwise, choose docker driver:: $ cat >> /opt/stack/devstack/local.conf << END ZUN_DRIVER=nova-docker IP_VERSION=4 disable_service n-net enable_service q-svc enable_service q-agt enable_service q-dhcp enable_service q-l3 enable_service q-meta enable_service neutron END

commit_message:
remove resource if not created

gnocchi dispatcher will attempt to patch resource after pushing
measures. if we can't create resource, we shouldn't bother trying
to handle the patch later on. also, add better logging to figure
out which resource failed

Change-Id: Icfb2a694230d5c185a2726463657d3a11ed59fe0

commit_message:
Fix logging for chrony

Chrony drops root to user 'chrony' on startup, and so was unable to
write to its log dir. Apply our usual chown on start pattern to fix
this.

Change-Id: Ia54cf5788ad015c3622902bca810bcbaaa948253
Closes-Bug: #1688216
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/63/462463/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CHRONY_LOG_DIR="/var/log/kolla/chrony" if [[ ! -d "${CHRONY_LOG_DIR}" ]]; then mkdir -p ${CHRONY_LOG_DIR}if [[ $(stat -c %U:%G ${CHRONY_LOG_DIR}) != "chrony:chrony" ]]; then chown chrony:chrony ${CHRONY_LOG_DIR}

commit_message:
ceph: store incoming measure in one file per metric

Currently, one RADOS object is created for each measure that is being sent.
This creates too many objects that can overload the Ceph cluster pretty fast.
This changes this behavior by storing the measures into one file per metric
instead, using the append operation which ought to be atomic.

Change-Id: Ifcfaa990bf5705b496b948940eafb6f1f7ac3308
Sem-Ver: api-break

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-03 06:38:08.000000000', 'files': ['karborclient/common/utils.py', 'karborclient/common/apiclient/base.py', 'karborclient/common/apiclient/exceptions.py', 'karborclient/common/apiclient/auth.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-karborclient/commit/68d0a7ece4e8e77bbe0bec740a6642b78a59cef5', 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I3bdceff37eb43058b9a4c7a1f55c2875eb61c9a4

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I3bdceff37eb43058b9a4c7a1f55c2875eb61c9a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-karborclient refs/changes/12/452612/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable vpnaas extension

In a stable branch of devstack, vpnaas isn't included in api extension list
used in tempest since [1].

[1] Iac8f858793d5ab514d6ba69b68d5420acd0fe903
    I1a4d1ea8c8d34b8cd1020e76597db6c67f85f6ec

commit_message:
Update services enabled for Barbican jobs

We used to get away with specifying simply "keystone" as an enabled
service to launch keystone, but now we need to specify "rabbit,mysql,key",
which was probably the proper way to enable the keystone dependencies all
along.

Change-Id: I3c450f085091f7aa6af7d778854695387bbaf333

Kubestack integrate OpenStack projects with Kubernetes for
multi-tenancy.

Kubestack is originated from Hypernetes [1][2], which is a multi-tenant
Kubernetes distro:

  Hypernetes = Bare-metal + Hyper + Kubernetes + KeyStone + Cinder +
  Neutron.

We renamed hypernetes to kubestack to align with the OpenStack Mission:

* It builds directly on Kubernetes and existing OpenStack services, such
  as Neutron, Keystone, Cinder, and potentially more.
* It is running directly berametal.
* It supports multiple container runtimes and is secure isolated if
  hypervisor-based container runtime (e.g. Hyper [3]) is configured.

Kubestack uses the Apache v2.0 license. All library dependencies allow for
unrestricted distribution and deployment.

[1] https://github.com/hyperhq/hypernetes
[2] http://blog.kubernetes.io/2016/05/hypernetes-security-and-multi-tenancy-in-kubernetes.html
[3] https://hypercontainer.io/

Change-Id: I13bf517ec808818c004db837763d8c7934c47a07
Signed-off-by: Pengfei Ni <feiskyer@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add project openstack/stackube.

Stackube integrates OpenStack projects with Kubernetes for
multi-tenancy. It aligns with the OpenStack Mission:

* Builds directly on Kubernetes and existing OpenStack services, such
  as Neutron, Keystone, Cinder, and potentially more.
* Runs directly baremetal.
* Supports multiple container runtimes and is secure isolated if
  hypervisor-based container runtime (e.g. Hyper [1]) is configured.

Stackube uses the Apache v2.0 license. All library dependencies allow for
unrestricted distribution and deployment.

[1] https://hypercontainer.io

Change-Id: I13bf517ec808818c004db837763d8c7934c47a07
Signed-off-by: Pengfei Ni <feiskyer@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix senlin gate job for service enabling

Senlin API and functional tests do not require any other services other
than the fundational ones (rabbitmq, mysql, keystone, etc) to be
enabled. Senlin integration tests explicitly requires some services to
be installed and configured. This patch fixes both cases to make sure
that the services enabled are explicitly spelt out. This is crutial in
the situation that some services may happen to break our gate jobs and
we have to spend a lot time debugging the gate.

Change-Id: Ia1cd2c918420a04757cdd92a309b82bc830951f2

added_lines: # api and functional tests uses only the fundamental services services=rabbit,mysql,dstat,key,tempest export OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES=$services services=rabbit,tempest,mysql,dstat,key services+=,n-api,n-cpu,n-cond,n-sch,n-crt # placement services mandatory for nova from ocata if [[ ! "stable/mitaka stable/newton" =~ $ZUUL_BRANCH ]]; then services+=,placement-api,placement-client fi services+=,g-api,g-reg services+=,c-sch,c-api,c-vol,c-bak services+=,q-svc,q-dhcp,q-meta,q-agt,q-l3 # Enable heat for mitaka (no devstack plugin available) if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" == "stable/mitaka" ]]; then services+=,h-api,h-api-cfn,h-api-cw,h-eng fi services+=q-lbaasv2, export OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES=$services

commit_message:
Enable hybrid and dual amqp1 tests in oslo.messaging

The AMQP 1.0 devstack plugin support a couple of different message bus
configurations.  This patch adds support for these additional
configurations to the dsvm-full and tempest-neutron-dsvm
oslo.messaging tests.

This patch also removes all the oslo.messaging mitaka/trusty tests as
mitaka is EOL.

Change-Id: Iccc60b634b81b9761c0ec564c5aa263582f13ebf

commit_message:
Move subnet event to db_base_plugin_v2

There isn't anything ML2-specific about this event.
It can just live in the same place as the SUBNET_GATEWAY event
to prepare for the elimination of the SUBNET_GATEWAY event.

Partial-Bug: #1690944
Change-Id: If2c18c5d52658e90ebf1fe4bea91254c1bc5062f

commit_message:
Zun execute without command returned 500

If we run "zun exec ..." without a command,
Zun server should return 400 (Bad request)
instead of 500 (Server fault) in this case.

Change-Id: I8e5a91668556b35fc3902d53737a122248601c50
Closes-Bug: #1690907

added_lines: The basic idea is to simplely support 'action_region' as an extra input param for actions of configured OpenStack projects.. list of module names for which the 'action_region' input param will be add to each of its actions. The reason for adding this option is, there may be some OpenStack services (e.g. Keystone) already support region(or similar2. Insert 'action_region' as an optional input param when registering OpenStackOpenStack actions and re-create again. 'action_region' will be added as input param automatically.* Add 'action_region' as action input param for modules specified in ``modules_support_region`` options. Use 'action_region' to construct OpenStack service client.* write tests to make sure 'action_region' is supported for configured OpenStack modules. * write tests to make sure 'action_region' is properly used to construct OpenStack service client.
deleted_lines: The basic idea is simple, support 'region' as an extra input param for all OpenStack actions. list of module names for which the 'region' input param will be add to each of its actions. The reason for adding this option is, there may be some OpenStack services (e.g. Keystone) already support region(or similar2. Insert 'region' as an optional input param when registering OpenStackOpenStack actions and re-create again. 'region' will be added as input param automatically.* Add 'region' as action input param for modules specified in ``modules_support_region`` options. Use 'region' to construct OpenStack * service client.* write tests to make sure 'region' is supported for configured OpenStack modules. * write tests to make sure 'region' is properly used to construct OpenStack service client.

commit_message:
Fix 'tox -e genconfig'

When running 'tox -e genconfig', it did fail with the following error:

  File "[..]/blazar/opts.py", line 21, in <module>
    import blazar.db.migration.cli
  File "[..]/blazar/db/migration/cli.py", line 28, in <module>
    gettext.install('blazar', unicode=1)
TypeError: install() got an unexpected keyword argument 'unicode'

This is the same as the congress bug #1396969.
This fixes it with the same way I16a19f51325285973f37b36aa0469537fca766a7

Change-Id: I6a95381f4724d69645fad994daacd5f36c53e7e9
Related-Bug: #1396969

commit_message:
Remove unused reference from config-generator

When operating `tox -e genconfig`, the tox did output the following
warning message:

  WARNING:stevedore.named:Could not load oslo.utils

because the oslo module doesn't have any config options.
This patch removes this invalid reference from config-generator.

Change-Id: I523c915c14cf00916224d5ce69f7c659e397dc7d

commit_message:
Move _cleanup_after_interface_removal to DVR SP

Move _cleanup_after_interface_removal to the DVR service provider
module along with its children.

Related: blueprint multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: I55507e0c5259d547a647847647da7ac2a2a246e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/76/429976/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.db.models import l3agent as rb_model registry.subscribe(self.cleanup_after_interface_removal, resources.ROUTER_INTERFACE, events.AFTER_DELETE) self._delete_csnat_router_interface_ports( cs_port = self._find_v6_router_port_by_network_and_device_owner( @base.call_only_if_router_associated @db_api.retry_if_session_inactive() def cleanup_after_interface_removal(self, resource, event, trigger, context, port, interface_info, router_id, **kwargs): """Handler to cleanup distributed resources after intf removal.""" # we calculate which hosts to notify by checking the hosts for # the removed port's subnets and then subtract out any hosts still # hosting the router for the remaining interfaces router_hosts_for_removed = self.l3plugin._get_dvr_hosts_for_subnets( context, subnet_ids={ip['subnet_id'] for ip in port['fixed_ips']}) router_hosts_after = self.l3plugin._get_dvr_hosts_for_router( context, router_id) removed_hosts = set(router_hosts_for_removed) - set(router_hosts_after) if removed_hosts: agents = self.l3plugin.get_l3_agents( context, filters={'host': removed_hosts}) binding_table = rb_model.RouterL3AgentBinding snat_binding = context.session.query(binding_table).filter_by( router_id=router_id).first() for agent in agents: is_this_snat_agent = ( snat_binding and snat_binding.l3_agent_id == agent['id']) if not is_this_snat_agent: self.l3plugin.l3_rpc_notifier.router_removed_from_agent( context, router_id, agent['host']) # if subnet_id not in interface_info, request was to remove by port sub_id = (interface_info.get('subnet_id') or port['fixed_ips'][0]['subnet_id']) router = self.l3plugin._get_router(context, router_id) is_multiple_prefix_csport = ( self._check_for_multiprefix_csnat_port_and_update( context, router, port['network_id'], sub_id)) if not is_multiple_prefix_csport: # Single prefix port - go ahead and delete the port self._delete_csnat_router_interface_ports( context.elevated(), router, subnet_id=sub_id) def _check_for_multiprefix_csnat_port_and_update( self, context, router, network_id, subnet_id): """Checks if the csnat port contains multiple ipv6 prefixes. If the csnat port contains multiple ipv6 prefixes for the given network when a router interface is deleted, make sure we don't delete the port when a single subnet is deleted and just update it with the right fixed_ip. This function returns true if it is a multiprefix port. """ if router.gw_port: # If router has a gateway port, check if it has IPV6 subnet cs_port = ( self._find_v6_router_port_by_network_and_device_owner( router, network_id, const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT)) if cs_port: fixed_ips = ( [fixedip for fixedip in cs_port['fixed_ips'] if fixedip['subnet_id'] != subnet_id]) if len(fixed_ips) == len(cs_port['fixed_ips']): # The subnet being detached from router is not part of # ipv6 router port. No need to update the multiprefix. return False if fixed_ips: # multiple prefix port - delete prefix from port self.l3plugin._core_plugin.update_port( context.elevated(), cs_port['id'], {'port': {'fixed_ips': fixed_ips}}) return True return False def _find_v6_router_port_by_network_and_device_owner( self, router, net_id, device_owner): for port in router.attached_ports: p = port['port'] if (p['network_id'] == net_id and p['device_owner'] == device_owner and self.l3plugin._port_has_ipv6_address(p)): return self.l3plugin._core_plugin._make_port_dict(p) def _delete_csnat_router_interface_ports(self, context, router, subnet_id=None): # Each csnat router interface port is associated # with a subnet, so we need to pass the subnet id to # delete the right ports. # TODO(markmcclain): This is suboptimal but was left to reduce # changeset size since it is late in cycle ports = [ rp.port.id for rp in router.attached_ports.filter_by( port_type=const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT) if rp.port ] c_snat_ports = self.l3plugin._core_plugin.get_ports( context, filters={'id': ports} ) for p in c_snat_ports: if subnet_id is None or not p['fixed_ips']: if not p['fixed_ips']: LOG.info(_LI("CSNAT port has no IPs: %s"), p) self.l3plugin._core_plugin.delete_port(context, p['id'], l3_port_check=False) else: if p['fixed_ips'][0]['subnet_id'] == subnet_id: LOG.debug("Subnet matches: %s", subnet_id) self.l3plugin._core_plugin.delete_port(context, p['id'], l3_port_check=False)

commit_message:
Move _update_snat_v6_addrs_after_intf_update to DVR SP

Move _update_snat_v6_addrs_after_intf_update to the DVR
service provider module.

Related: blueprint multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: I22586bd472f967d6eebd1c3b9aa3bcead307b640
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/75/429975/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import excutils from neutron._i18n import _, _LE, _LI, _LW registry.subscribe(self.update_snat_v6_addrs_after_intf_update, resources.ROUTER_INTERFACE, events.AFTER_CREATE) @base.call_only_if_router_associated def update_snat_v6_addrs_after_intf_update(self, resource, event, triger, context, subnets, port, router_id, new_interface, **kwargs): if new_interface: # _add_csnat_on_interface_create handler deals with new ports return # if not a new interface, the interface was added to a new subnet, # which is the first in this list subnet = subnets[0] if not subnet or subnet['ip_version'] != 6: return # NOTE: For IPv6 additional subnets added to the same # network we need to update the CSNAT port with respective # IPv6 subnet # Add new prefix to an existing ipv6 csnat port with the # same network id if one exists admin_ctx = context.elevated() l3p = self.l3plugin router = l3p._get_router(admin_ctx, router_id) cs_port = l3p._find_v6_router_port_by_network_and_device_owner( router, subnet['network_id'], const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT) if not cs_port: return new_fixed_ip = {'subnet_id': subnet['id']} fixed_ips = list(cs_port['fixed_ips']) fixed_ips.append(new_fixed_ip) try: updated_port = l3p._core_plugin.update_port( admin_ctx, cs_port['id'], {'port': {'fixed_ips': fixed_ips}}) except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): # we need to try to undo the updated router # interface from above so it's not out of sync # with the csnat port. # TODO(kevinbenton): switch to taskflow to manage # these rollbacks. @db_api.retry_db_errors def revert(): # TODO(kevinbenton): even though we get the # port each time, there is a potential race # where we update the port with stale IPs if # another interface operation is occurring at # the same time. This can be fixed in the # future with a compare-and-swap style update # using the revision number of the port. p = l3p._core_plugin.get_port(admin_ctx, port['id']) rollback_fixed_ips = [ip for ip in p['fixed_ips'] if ip['subnet_id'] != subnet['id']] upd = {'port': {'fixed_ips': rollback_fixed_ips}} l3p._core_plugin.update_port(admin_ctx, port['id'], upd) try: revert() except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE("Failed to revert change " "to router port %s."), port['id']) LOG.debug("CSNAT port updated for IPv6 subnet: %s", updated_port)

added_lines: from neutron_lib import exceptions as n_excfrom neutron._i18n import _, _LI, _LWfrom neutron.db import api as db_apifrom neutron.plugins.common import utils as p_utils registry.subscribe(self.add_csnat_on_interface_create, resources.ROUTER_INTERFACE, events.BEFORE_CREATE) @base.call_only_if_router_associated @db_api.retry_if_session_inactive() def add_csnat_on_interface_create(self, resource, event, trigger, context, router_db, port, **kwargs): """Event handler to for csnat port creation on interface creation.""" if not router_db.gw_port: return admin_context = context.elevated() self._add_csnat_router_interface_port( admin_context, router_db, port['network_id'], port['fixed_ips'][-1]['subnet_id']) def _add_csnat_router_interface_port( self, context, router, network_id, subnet_id, do_pop=True): """Add SNAT interface to the specified router and subnet.""" port_data = {'tenant_id': '', 'network_id': network_id, 'fixed_ips': [{'subnet_id': subnet_id}], 'device_id': router.id, 'device_owner': const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT, 'admin_state_up': True, 'name': ''} snat_port = p_utils.create_port(self._core_plugin, context, {'port': port_data}) if not snat_port: msg = _("Unable to create the SNAT Interface Port") raise n_exc.BadRequest(resource='router', msg=msg) with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): router_port = l3_models.RouterPort( port_id=snat_port['id'], router_id=router.id, port_type=const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT ) context.session.add(router_port) if do_pop: return self._populate_mtu_and_subnets_for_ports(context, [snat_port]) return snat_port snat_port = self._add_csnat_router_interface_port(

added_lines: from neutron.extensions import portbindings registry.subscribe(self.delete_dvr_internal_ports, resources.ROUTER_GATEWAY, events.AFTER_DELETE) @base.call_only_if_router_associated def delete_dvr_internal_ports(self, event, trigger, resource, context, router, network_id, new_network_id, **kwargs): """ GW port AFTER_DELETE event handler to cleanup DVR ports. This event is emitted when a router gateway port is being deleted, so go ahead and delete the csnat ports and the floatingip agent gateway port associated with the dvr router. """ if not new_network_id: self.l3plugin.delete_csnat_router_interface_ports( context.elevated(), router) # NOTE(Swami): Delete the Floatingip agent gateway port # on all hosts when it is the last gateway port in the # given external network. filters = {'network_id': [network_id], 'device_owner': [const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW]} ext_net_gw_ports = self.l3plugin._core_plugin.get_ports( context.elevated(), filters) if not ext_net_gw_ports: self._delete_floatingip_agent_gateway_port( context.elevated(), None, network_id) # Send the information to all the L3 Agent hosts # to clean up the fip namespace as it is no longer required. self.l3plugin.l3_rpc_notifier.delete_fipnamespace_for_ext_net( context, network_id) def _delete_floatingip_agent_gateway_port( self, context, host_id, ext_net_id): """Function to delete FIP gateway port with given ext_net_id.""" # delete any fip agent gw port device_filter = {'device_owner': [const.DEVICE_OWNER_AGENT_GW], 'network_id': [ext_net_id]} ports = self.l3plugin._core_plugin.get_ports(context, filters=device_filter) for p in ports: if not host_id or p[portbindings.HOST_ID] == host_id: self.l3plugin._core_plugin.ipam.delete_port(context, p['id']) if host_id: return

commit_message:
Move _create_snat_intf_ports_if_not_exists to DVR SP

This moves the _create_snat_intf_ports_if_not_exists to the DVR
service provider module and its child functions not called by
anything else.

Related: blueprint multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: Iccd478fd8243ceb9672b402047e5ddaa37c798af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/72/429972/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib import constants as constfrom neutron._i18n import _LI, _LWfrom neutron.db.models import l3 as l3_modelsfrom neutron.extensions import l3 registry.subscribe(self.create_snat_interfaces_after_change, resources.ROUTER, events.AFTER_CREATE) def create_snat_interfaces_after_change(self, resource, event, trigger, context, router_id, router, request_attrs, router_db, **kwargs): if not router.get(l3.EXTERNAL_GW_INFO) or not router['distributed']: # we don't care if it's not distributed or not attached to an # external network return if event == events.AFTER_UPDATE: # after an update, we check to see if it was a migration or a # gateway attachment old_router = kwargs['old_router'] do_create = (not old_router['distributed'] or not old_router.get(l3.EXTERNAL_GW_INFO)) if not do_create: return if not self._create_snat_intf_ports_if_not_exists( context.elevated(), router_db): LOG.debug("SNAT interface ports not created: %s", router_db['id']) return router_db def _create_snat_intf_ports_if_not_exists(self, context, router): """Function to return the snat interface port list. This function will return the snat interface port list if it exists. If the port does not exist it will create new ports and then return the list. """ port_list = self._get_snat_interface_ports_for_router( context, router.id) if port_list: self.l3plugin._populate_mtu_and_subnets_for_ports( context, port_list) return port_list port_list = [] int_ports = ( rp.port for rp in router.attached_ports.filter_by( port_type=const.DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_INTERFACE ) ) LOG.info(_LI('SNAT interface port list does not exist,' ' so create one: %s'), port_list) for intf in int_ports: if intf.fixed_ips: # Passing the subnet for the port to make sure the IP's # are assigned on the right subnet if multiple subnet # exists snat_port = self.l3plugin._add_csnat_router_interface_port( context, router, intf['network_id'], intf['fixed_ips'][0]['subnet_id'], do_pop=False) port_list.append(snat_port) if port_list: self.l3plugin._populate_mtu_and_subnets_for_ports( context, port_list) return port_list def _get_snat_interface_ports_for_router(self, context, router_id): """Return all existing snat_router_interface ports.""" qry = context.session.query(l3_models.RouterPort) qry = qry.filter_by( router_id=router_id, port_type=const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT ) ports = [self.l3plugin._core_plugin._make_port_dict(rp.port) for rp in qry] return ports

commit_message:
Move _create_dvr_floating_gw_port to DVR flavor

This moves the _create_dvr_floating_gw_port method and a method
of which it is the only caller to the DVR flavor. It also gets rid
of the old mixin tests and adds similar tests for the DVR service
provider module.

Related: blueprint multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: I92412c95a97a2806d11899c0019d97af78799140

added_lines: from oslo_log import log as logging from neutron._i18n import _LW from neutron.callbacks import events from neutron.callbacks import registry from neutron.callbacks import resources from neutron.common import utils as n_utils from neutron.db.models import allowed_address_pair as aap_models from neutron.db import models_v2LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def __init__(self, l3plugin): super(DvrDriver, self).__init__(l3plugin) registry.subscribe(self.create_dvr_floating_gw_port, resources.FLOATING_IP, events.AFTER_UPDATE) @base.call_only_if_router_associated def create_dvr_floating_gw_port(self, resource, event, trigger, context, router_id, fixed_port_id, floating_ip_id, floating_network_id, fixed_ip_address, **kwargs): """Create floating agent gw port for DVR. Floating IP Agent gateway port will be created when a floatingIP association happens. """ associate_fip = fixed_port_id and floating_ip_id if associate_fip and router_id: admin_ctx = context.elevated() router_dict = self.get_router(admin_ctx, router_id) # Check if distributed router and then create the # FloatingIP agent gateway port if router_dict.get('distributed'): hostid = self.l3plugin._get_dvr_service_port_hostid( context, fixed_port_id) if hostid: # FIXME (Swami): This FIP Agent Gateway port should be # created only once and there should not be a duplicate # for the same host. Until we find a good solution for # augmenting multiple server requests we should use the # existing flow. fip_agent_port = ( self.l3plugin.create_fip_agent_gw_port_if_not_exists( admin_ctx, floating_network_id, hostid)) LOG.debug("FIP Agent gateway port: %s", fip_agent_port) else: # If not hostid check if the fixed ip provided has to # deal with allowed_address_pairs for a given service # port. Get the port_dict, inherit the service port host # and device owner(if it does not exist). port = self.l3plugin._core_plugin.get_port( admin_ctx, fixed_port_id) allowed_device_owners = ( n_utils.get_dvr_allowed_address_pair_device_owners()) # NOTE: We just need to deal with ports that do not # have a device_owner and ports that are owned by the # dvr service ports except for the compute port and # dhcp port. if (port['device_owner'] == "" or port['device_owner'] in allowed_device_owners): addr_pair_active_service_port_list = ( self._get_ports_for_allowed_address_pair_ip( admin_ctx, port['network_id'], fixed_ip_address)) if not addr_pair_active_service_port_list: return if len(addr_pair_active_service_port_list) > 1: LOG.warning(_LW("Multiple active ports associated " "with the allowed_address_pairs.")) return self._inherit_service_port_and_arp_update( context, addr_pair_active_service_port_list[0], port) def _get_ports_for_allowed_address_pair_ip( self, context, network_id, fixed_ip): """Return all active ports associated with the allowed_addr_pair ip.""" query = context.session.query( models_v2.Port).filter( models_v2.Port.id == aap_models.AllowedAddressPair.port_id, aap_models.AllowedAddressPair.ip_address == fixed_ip, models_v2.Port.network_id == network_id, models_v2.Port.admin_state_up == True) # noqa return query.all()

commit_message:
Remove serverproviders & rarely used deployers

Unfortunatelly seems like nobody is using deployers for deploying
their clouds and mostly people would like just to execute their code.

This is first patch that helps to us focus on work that should be done

1) Remove server provides
2) Remove engines that uses server providers

After this patch we are going to refactor Engine interface
and return DevStack Engine

Change-Id: Iaaeffc3fa06255afb45ba18d300a67c843ba57dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/56/464556/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from rally.deployment.serverprovider.providers import cobbler from tests.unit import test class TestCobblerProvider(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): self.config = {"type": "CobblerProvider", "host": "h1", "user": "u1", "password": "p1", "system_password": "p2", "selector": {"profile": "p1", "owners": "o1"}} self.rendered = {"ip_address_eth3": "", "ip_address_eth1": "1.1.1.1", "power_user": "fake_root", "redhat_management_key": "fake_key", "name": "fake_name"} self.system_names = ["s1", "s2"] self.token = "token" self.handle = "handle" super(TestCobblerProvider, self).setUp() def create_mocks(self, mock_server, is_no_ip, provider): mock_server.find_system = mock.Mock(return_value=self.system_names) mock_server.login = mock.Mock(return_value=self.token) mock_server.get_system_handle = mock.Mock(return_value=self.handle) mock_server.power_system = mock.Mock() if is_no_ip: self.rendered["ip_address_eth1"] = "" mock_server.get_system_as_rendered = mock.Mock( return_value=self.rendered) provider.cobbler = mock_server @mock.patch("six.moves.xmlrpc_client.Server") def test_create_servers(self, mock_server): provider = cobbler.CobblerProvider(config=self.config, deployment=None) mock_server.assert_called_once_with(uri="http://h1/cobbler_api") self.create_mocks(mock_server=mock_server, is_no_ip=False, provider=provider) credentials = provider.create_servers() mock_server.find_system.assert_called_once_with( self.config["selector"]) mock_server.login.assert_called_with(self.config["user"], self.config["password"]) mock_server.login.call_count = len(self.system_names) mock_server.power_system.assert_called_with(self.handle, "reboot", self.token) self.assertEqual(["1.1.1.1"] * 2, [s.host for s in credentials]) self.assertEqual(["fake_root"] * 2, [s.user for s in credentials]) self.assertEqual(["p2"] * 2, [s.password for s in credentials]) self.assertEqual(["fake_key"] * 2, [s.key for s in credentials]) self.assertEqual([22] * 2, [s.port for s in credentials]) @mock.patch("six.moves.xmlrpc_client.Server") def test_create_servers_when_selects_nothing(self, mock_server): provider = cobbler.CobblerProvider(config=self.config, deployment=None) mock_server.find_system = mock.Mock(return_value=[]) provider.cobbler = mock_server self.assertRaisesRegexp(RuntimeError, "No associated systems selected by {.*}$", provider.create_servers) @mock.patch("six.moves.xmlrpc_client.Server") def test_create_servers_when_no_ip_found(self, mock_server): provider = cobbler.CobblerProvider(config=self.config, deployment=None) self.create_mocks(mock_server=mock_server, is_no_ip=True, provider=provider) self.assertRaisesRegexp(RuntimeError, "No valid ip address found for system '.*'$", provider.create_servers)

subject: Update host cpu util calculation to consider idle proc cycles
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-26 11:54:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/d1b6f98e7848d47a0450ffcd16f2d37a7cf239de', 'message': 'Update host cpu util calculation to consider idle proc cycles

The Lpar utilization used to consider donatedProcCycles. As
per discussion with hypervisor team, donatedProcCycles are
not guaranteed to be utilised by any other Lpar on the host. So,
from host perspective, it might get utilised by another lpar as uncapped
or it might not get utilised. Since we are already including uncapped
proc cycles in calculation, we need to ignore donated. Also, the
formula needs to take into account idle proc cycles on lpar.

Change-Id: Ia26d16796be21320eb64f2be15f958c1d0b0d174

commit_message:
Update host cpu util calculation to consider idle proc cycles

The Lpar utilization used to consider donatedProcCycles. As
per discussion with hypervisor team, donatedProcCycles are
not guaranteed to be utilised by any other Lpar on the host. So,
from host perspective, it might get utilised by another lpar as uncapped
or it might not get utilised. Since we are already including uncapped
proc cycles in calculation, we need to ignore donated. Also, the
formula needs to take into account idle proc cycles on lpar.

Change-Id: Ia26d16796be21320eb64f2be15f958c1d0b0d174
Closes-Bug: 1686422

Fix exception message for DuplicateBgpPeerIpException

Exception message was located under '_message' field of the exception
object, instead of the expected 'message' field.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I4243bc7d08973d4753141ce1047913af4d16c525

commit_message:
Save management switch mac address on deploy and use on rebuild

On rebuild, since the VM gets destroyed, all its associated slot data is
lost. Also cloud-init does not update network config if instance id
has not changed, as a result a new mgmt switch mac address is not getting set
on VM after rebuild. This causes the VM RMC state to go to inactive.
The fix proposes to store the  management switch mac address in
instance system metadata. This does not get destroyed and gets reused
over rebuild, allowing the VM to use the old mac address while creating
new CNA. On VM, since it gets booted from same boot volume, the same
network information gets reused.

Change-Id: I745f40d4116de353e6824740849c176384feb745
Closes-Bug: 1689518

let's change the document name from "i18n-guide"
to simply "doc".

Implements: blueprint i18n-guide-translation

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I3a2fc7779fa0c806827d9eda2ffdbc207788b22d

to be used for ISCSI volume driver.

added_lines: from pypowervm.tasks import partition self._nl_vios_ids = None @property def vios_uuids(self): """List the UUIDs of the Virtual I/O Servers hosting the storage.""" # Get the hosting UUID if self._nl_vios_ids is None: nl_vios_wrap = partition.get_mgmt_partition(self.adapter) self._nl_vios_ids = [nl_vios_wrap.uuid] return self._nl_vios_ids # If the vios does not match return if vios_w.uuid not in self.vios_uuids: return False # if the vios uuid does not match, return if vios_w.uuid not in self.vios_uuids: return False

commit_message:
Add docker-ce in check_docker and updated docker daemon with proxy configuration

For devstack-plugin-container plugin, existing docker-ce checks added in zun
and kuryr-libnetwork. Update - Proxy configuration changes and
docker daemon command is deprecated since 1.12, update with dockerd command

Change-Id: Ie090f310e39693692b8850cdf142715494af245a
Closes-Bug: #1684057
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork refs/changes/12/460412/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The following variables are assumed to be defined by certain functions: # # - ``http_proxy`` ``https_proxy`` ``no_proxy`` dpkg -s docker-engine > /dev/null 2>&1 || dpkg -s docker-ce > /dev/null 2>&1 rpm -q docker-engine > /dev/null 2>&1 || rpm -q docker > /dev/null 2>&1 || rpm -q docker-ce > /dev/null 2>&1 rm /etc/docker/daemon.json run_process docker-engine "sudo HTTP_PROXY=$http_proxy HTTPS_PROXY=$https_proxy NO_PROXY=$no_proxy /usr/bin/dockerd -H unix://$KURYR_DOCKER_ENGINE_SOCKET_FILE -H tcp://0.0.0.0:$KURYR_DOCKER_ENGINE_PORT --cluster-store etcd://localhost:$KURYR_ETCD_PORT"
deleted_lines: dpkg -s docker-engine > /dev/null 2>&1 rpm -q docker-engine > /dev/null 2>&1 || rpm -q docker > /dev/null 2>&1 run_process docker-engine "sudo /usr/bin/docker daemon -H unix://$KURYR_DOCKER_ENGINE_SOCKET_FILE -H tcp://0.0.0.0:$KURYR_DOCKER_ENGINE_PORT --cluster-store etcd://localhost:$KURYR_ETCD_PORT"

commit_message:
Add snapshot ability to stack

We current use Backup for stack-snapshot because snapshot will lock resource
which been snapshotted, but user can not snapshot (or doing imcremental
backup) the resources in stack, which means user can only do backup with
longer time and bigger disk space then doing snapshot. For user who did
schedule backup will require massive disk space. Also Backup lock Stack for
a period of time. IMO, we can introduce snapshot by some limitation to avoid
resource locking issues.

blueprint snapshot-stack

Change-Id: I4cc866e3eadd63f8556469b30ad87cd18a2ab485
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/15/243015/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html =========================== Snapshot Stack =========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/snapshot-stack Add Snapshot ability for stack-snapshot. We current use Backup for stack-snapshot because snapshot will lock resource which been snapshotted, but user can not snapshot (or doing imcremental backup) the resources in stack, which means user can only do backup with longer time and bigger disk space then doing snapshot. For user who did schedule backup will require massive disk space. Also Backup lock Stack for a period of time. IMO, we can introduce snapshot by some limitation to avoid resource locking issues. usecase: * User need to backup/snapshot their resource a lot, but have only limited space and can not use backup for every single time. Snapshot can help them to reduce spaces waste. * User have very dynamic stack, snapshot action can reduce locking time of stack and make sure user can operate with their stack after a short period of time to perform stack-snapshot. * User have very heavy loading resources, that can not afford locking time of backup. Those user can be benefit by just perform snapshot for stack. The disadvantage for this is that the stack resoruce will be locked by snapshot, so we should delete the snapshot during resource deletion in stack. Problem description =================== We use backup under stack-snapshot, but for user do backup periodically, will not be able to use stack-snapshot, because they really can not afford the storage space cost for it. When backup happens, it always take longer time then snapshot. Means we may lock stack for long time. For those user have a dynamic stack, heavy loading resources, or have a tight schedule for backup/snapshot. This may become a problem since our goal is to operate stack concurrently. Proposed change =============== We can implement either imcremental backup and snapshot in to stack-snapshot, and give user more way to choose what kind of back out method they required. Stack-snapshot will do backup for default, and we can change to other way if user spicify using snapshot (or imcremental backup). For those snapshot that create by stack, should be deleted during stack deletion or action which remove resoruce out of stack. Documentation and test are required. Alternatives ------------ * Using backup and only implement imcremental backup to replace snapshot, but IIRC some resources only have snapshot not imcremental backup. * Add more documentation to convince user to use backup in stack-snapshot, or maybe we just create stack-backup option to replace stack-snapshot and deprecate it. We can discuss the option to keep the resoruce and snapshot after stack deleted. This may be mark the delete-policy to retain resources. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Rico Lin <rico-lin> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: mitaka-1 Work Items ---------- * Add snapshot option to stack-snapshot * Change stack delete or resource remove (from stack) action, to make sure we remove snapshot before the action. * Add imcremental backup option to stck-snapshot * Add snapshot for resources (if capable) * Add imcremental backup for resoruces (if capable) * Add test * Add documentation Dependencies ============ None

subject: Deprecate local environment file under etc
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-04 08:03:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs/commit/09020c789c9b529a30d959020b0604d469ba4602', 'message': 'Shared Scope Environment

Current Environment is store on disk directly, and it is unsyncable between
different environment config on different hosts. Consider that user may have
different environment setting under different scope. We should create
environments command and move to database, give user ability to dynamically
set (or registry) environment parameters, resource_registry, or other section
in environment file, and make sure all heat-engine can share same environment.

blueprint shared-scope-environment

Change-Id: Ic68a57ab3e4fad2aebe31d08e0a2426caadc41f4

Current Global Environment is store on local disk directly, and it is
unsyncable between different environment config on different hosts.
This implement global environment by environment object which can defined as

commit_message:
Deprecate local environment file under etc

Current Environment is store on disk under /etc/environment.d/ directly,
which means user keep local copy for environment and it is unsyncable between
different physical hosts. Consider that user may make mistake to have
different environment setting under different hosts. We should give user
abilities to dynamically set (or registry) environment parameters,
resource_registry, or other section in global environment, and make sure all
heat-engine can share same environment. Which means that we can introduce new
kind of global environment registration way, and avoid hard code in local
environment that even require restart the service to make it work.

blueprint deprecate-local-env-file

Change-Id: Ic68a57ab3e4fad2aebe31d08e0a2426caadc41f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/16/241516/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ================================ Shared Scope Environment ================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/shared-scope-environment Implement a scalable environment, which is shared between all Heat-engine hosts. With multi-scope hierarchy, we can provide very dynamic environment. And the most importantly we can get rid of putting environment file on local disk. Problem description =================== Current Environment is store on disk directly, and it is unsyncable between different environment config on different hosts. Consider that user may have different environment setting under different scope. We should create environments command and move to database, give user ability to dynamically set (or registry) environment parameters, resource_registry, or other section in environment file, and make sure all heat-engine can share same environment. Proposed change =============== * Create Database schema for Environment Environment topology for Environment resources. 1. environment table_name: environment Colume: ------- id: Environement object ID. Integer value. Primary key. name: Environment name. Name for environment. String value. description: Environemnt description. String value. scope: Environemnt scope. Json value. force: Forcec to replace environemt parameter or registry. Boolean value. 2. resource_registry table_name: resource_registry Colume: ------- id: Resource registry object id. Integer value. Primary key. environment: Environment for this registry. Foreign key. name: Resource registry name. String value. description: Environemnt resource registry description. String value. resource_type: Resource type. String value. resource_template: template for resource. String value. 3. environment parameter table_name: environment_parameter Colume: ------- id: Parameter object id. Integer value. Primary key. key: Parameter key. String value. value: Parameter value. String value. environment: Environment for this parameter. Foreign key. name: Parameter name. String value. description: Environemnt parameter description. String value. * Create object for environment give user ability to dynamically set (or registry) environment parameters, resource_registry, or other section in environment file. 3. Environment Required Properties: -------------------- name: Name for environemnt. String value. Update allowed. parameters: A set of parameter for this environment. List value. Update allowed. resource_registry: A set of resource_registry for this environment. List value. Update allowed. Optional Properties: -------------------- description: Description for environment. String value. Update allowed. scope: Define Scope for environment. Map value. Update allowed. force: Force to overwrite. Boolean value. Update allowed. 2. Resource_registry Required Properties: -------------------- name: Name for environemnt resource registry. String value. Update allowed. resource_type: Namespace for resource to registry. String value. Update allowed. resource_template: Template file. Map value. Update allowed. Optional Properties: -------------------- description: Description for environment resource registry. String value. Update allowed. 3. Parameter Required Properties: -------------------- name: Name for environemnt parameter. String value. Update allowed. parameter_key: Key for parameter. String value. Update allowed. parameter_value: Value for parameter. String value. Update allowed. Optional Properties: -------------------- description: Description for environment parameter. String value. Update allowed. * Add Environment functions Functions to handle environment action. Change to load environment base on environment functions, give user ability to dynamically set (or registry) environment parameters, resource_registry, or other section in environment file. * Add Environment commands Environment can be writen on environment file or given by stack, and now it can create by environment command whcih will triger Environment functions. This implement will load environment file as basic environment objects. Command: -------- * heat environment-create <name> -f <FILE> [-P <KEY1=VALUE1;KEY2=VALUE2...>] name: environment name file: file for environment file. parameter: A map to store scope, parameter, and resoruce registry. * heat environment-update <name> -f <FILE> [-P <KEY1=VALUE1;KEY2=VALUE2...>] * heat environment-delete <name or ID> * heat environment-show <name or ID> * heat environment-list --filter filter: filt environment. Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Rico Lin <rico-lin> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: mitaka-1 Work Items ---------- * Create Database schema for Environment. * Create Object for Environment. * Add Environment functions. * Add Environment commands. * Add test. * Add sample in document. Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
[AMQP 1.0] if RPC call is configured as presettled ignore acks

The pre-settled configuration option was being ignored in the case of
RPC call transfers.

Change-Id: I35989c8a653bac0d9a7c3e33a8af2027574f4bd9
Closes-Bug: 1680905

commit_message:
Trivial: Use correct words in inequality assertions

We should use the correct words 'less than' or 'greater than' when
asserting inequalities rather than saying "larger than", "more than"
or "higher than".

Change-Id: I74f15ea53bdec7b051e34676da5e35fca6cbd9ca

commit_message:
Handle NotFound when listing role assignments for deleted users

Keystone can use an external identity store for the users, and
store assignments for these users in the SQL database that it
manages. When a user has been deleted directly in the external
identity store, these assignments will persist. Therefore when
listing role assignments and asking for names to be included,
keystone will try to get information of the user and fail with
NotFound.

This catches the NotFound exception of the get_user and get_group
calls and fills the user values with and empty string.

Change-Id: Iec3e12f6cd1402e1e3f192b0ede5d608bd41ca1d
Closes-Bug: 1684820
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/54/458954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: # Note(knikolla): Try to get the user, otherwise # if the user has been deleted in the backend # use populate the values. _user = self.identity_api.get_user(value) except exception.NotFound: _user['name'] = 'N/A' _user['user_domain_id'] = 'N/A' _user['user_domain_name'] = 'N/A' try: # Note(knikolla): Try to get the group, otherwise # if the group has been deleted in the backend # use empty values. _group = self.identity_api.get_group(value) except exception.NotFound: _group['name'] = 'N/A' _group['group_domain_id'] = 'N/A' _group['group_domain_name'] = 'N/A'

commit_message:
Fix node get_detail for load-balancing

The get_details() call is supposed to be invoked on a Node object
instead of a DB object. This patch fixes the problem.

Closes-Bug: 1690116
Change-Id: I51bc0809c64296681e56993d4fddee14173b8a07

commit_message:
Copy template version when update fails

When an update fails, we may have copy some chunk of resources or
parameters to the new template. If the version was updated and the new
resources require the version, this can lead to a state where the stack
is in an usable state. This synchronizes the version when a failure
happens.

Change-Id: I2faf8f3541fc800ea61c417e5575f4a56a83665b
Closes-Bug: #1620696
(cherry picked from commit 45fde101979d9d3f446cd937e5cc4c47539cc5bc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/85/464585/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Update the template version, in case new things were used self.t.t[newstack.t.version[0]] = max( newstack.t.version[1], self.t.version[1]) backup_stack.t.t[newstack.t.version[0]] = max( newstack.t.version[1], self.t.version[1])

commit_message:
Fix an issue with image interface of nova

Nova team tries to reduce the number of proxy APIs. It is a good thing
in terms of Nova, but it produces some pain for other teams:)

One of such proxy APIs is image interface. It is not available any more
since novaclient >= 8.0.0

This patch moves usage if all image interfaces from novaclient to
glanceclient.

Also, it should fix VMTask scenarios

Change-Id: Id5bec277736380343270d3518b0b400efc255d9a

commit_message:
Change keystone_authtoken configs

Blazar uses os_auth_host, os_auth_port and os_auth_version to the auth
uri for now. However, current approach can not be applied to uri with some
prefixes such like "http://127.0.0.1/identity".

In this patch, authentification is executed by using "keystone_authtoken"
configs. This patch enables us to use any forms of auth uri.

Closes-Bug: #1681419
Change-Id: I7c8728593ecf503b23d742a5f464af8a2a6e5253
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/30/460430/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Remove unnecessary create_volume calls

This patch removes unnecessary ``create_volume`` calls from
``test_volume_basic_crud_rbac`` and also removes unusued
``CONF`` variable.

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I73ca5fc046ad04505b52ca93c9bbdbfd72405aed

commit_message:
exclude sphinx 1.6.1

The 1.6.1 release of sphinx has introduced a couple of backwards
incompatibilities that break our doc and release notes builds. Block it
until we can work around the issue.

Change-Id: I4aa222b84fee56feb78fa3ed6891552de7022e42
Related-Bug: #1691224
Related-Bug: #1691129
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Change log level on _get_hba_channel_scsi_target

On the FC initiator, when we are doing a scan we try to narrow the scope
of the scan as much as possible, for this purpose we try to get the HBA
channel and SCSI targets for an HBA.

Unfortunately the mechanism we have implemented to detect these two
parameters is not universal and will only work on FC targets that
implement a single WWN.

This is not a big problem as the code is capable of operating normally
without those 2 parameters, it's just that the filtering on the scan is
not as precise as it could be.

So the issue is that we are logging as an error when we cannot get that
information, which is clearly misleading to anybody reading the logs.

This patch changes the log level from error to debug.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ieec4868b9da0d0af5b951fb01257a742c440aeee

Veritas os-brick connector should use privsep

Also included minor bug fix to make Veritas os-brick connector CI work.

commit_message:
Fix allow_ssh context

python-novaclient doesn't support networking interface after 8.0.0
release, so we need to use neutronclient directly.

This patch fixes an arguments to use neutronclient properly. Failed
scenarios are still turned off due to issue with image interface of
novaclient (see further patches for more details)

Change-Id: Ie04dc023c8d9cdcbd28683affa0f227f693fadfc

commit_message:
Add additional assertions for volume transfer test

When a transferred volume is accepted by another user in different
tenant, the user and tenant of the volume should be changed. This
patch is to add explicit assertions for these two attributes in
volume transfer test.

Change-Id: Iaaee981c5d0c17133cc426479904c584e28f8578

commit_message:
consume neutron-lib callbacks

The callback system in neutron has moved to neutron-lib
and hence consumers need to follow suit. See
Ib6baee2aaeb044aaba42a97b35900d75dd43021f for more details.

Change-Id: I3ae32c1a561d764cd67001ec57d8614d5e5cfb50

commit_message:
_is_physical_chassis returns False if object not in db_store2

If _is_physical_chassis is called with a proxy to a non-existent
chassis, i.e. one that does not exist in db_store2, return False.

We cannot connect to a remote port on a chassis which does not exit.
When the chassis will be added, the relevant ports will be added.

This change also adds the helper function is_model_proxy, to test if an
instance is a model proxy, but without accessing the private _ModelProxy
base class.

Change-Id: I8b81ba8350371c5539e75a73dd9b6911f8f47c52
